meanings.definition: Showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
meanings.sent1: The apatetic student stared blankly at the wall during class.
meanings.sent2: She gave an apatetic response when asked about her favorite movie.
meanings.sent3: The apatetic cat lazily watched the birds outside, unbothered by their chirping.
meanings.sent4: His apatetic demeanor made it hard for others to connect with him emotionally.
meanings.sent5: The apatetic atmosphere in the room was palpable, with everyone seeming disinterested.

meanings.sent1: The apatetic performance failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her apatetic expression revealed nothing about her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The apatetic response to the exciting news was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The apatetic landscape seemed devoid of any life or energy.
meanings.sent5: His apatetic voice lacked the usual enthusiasm he was known for.

meanings.sent1: The apatetic customer barely acknowledged the waiter taking their order.
meanings.sent2: She remained apatetic to the ongoing debate, showing no interest in either side.
meanings.sent3: The apatetic reaction to the surprise party left the organizers disappointed.
meanings.sent4: His apatetic attitude towards his own success puzzled his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The apatetic audience sat silently, unmoved by the powerful speech.
